name: Ukama
headline: Empowering anyone to build  cellular network

founders.name: Kashif Ali, Founder
founders.description: Kashif Ali (Founder & CEO) prior to starting Ukama co-founded Endaga and was acquired by Facebook in 2015. At Facebook he founded and led the OpenCellular project from inception to production deployments with multiple tier-1 operators around the world. He also did his postdoctoral work at UC Berkeley in rural connectivity and has Ph.D. from Queen’s University in Canada.

# The future of cellular Internet
Join mailing list
Backed by:
![YC logo](http://www.ukama.com/_next/image/?url=%2Fimages%2Fptr_logo_yc.png&w=256&q=75)
![50Y logo](http://www.ukama.com/_next/image/?url=%2Fimages%2Fptr_logo_fy.png&w=128&q=75)
##### Ukama offers an open access complete cellular network solution without the price tag and technical expertise required of traditional setups.Lacking coverage? Unsatisfied by current solutions? Run your own network with ease to enjoy long range, secure, and affordable connectivity.
Connected by Ukama
Run your own internet provider business, provide secure and widespread connectivity to your organization, or connect your community - the possibilities are endless.
![connected-by-ukama](http://www.ukama.com/_next/image/?url=%2Fimages%2Fconnectedby.png&w=3840&q=75)
##### Our cellular Internet in a box kits make network setup simple , so you can focus on what you do best.
###### Learn more

generated_description:
**Ukama Overview**

Founded in 2020 and hailing from Pleasanton, CA, Ukama is a dynamic startup that empowers anyone to build their own cellular network. A proud part of Y Combinator's S20 batch, Ukama operates with a dedicated team of seven who are passionate about democratizing connectivity. 

**Mission & Vision**

The core mission of Ukama is straightforward yet transformative: to make cellular internet accessible to all. They achieve this through innovative "cellular Internet in a box" solutions, designed to simplify the setup of personal or community-wide networks. If you’re dissatisfied with current connectivity options or facing coverage challenges, Ukama invites you to run your own secure and affordable network.

**Key Offerings**

Ukama offers an open access, complete cellular network solution without the hefty costs and technical barriers usually associated with traditional systems. Whether you're looking to start your own internet service provider business or connect your community, their kits streamline the process, allowing users to focus on what they do best.

- **Products**: 
  - Cellular Internet in a box
  - Open access and decentralized technology stack

This makes it easy to establish long-range, secure connections with minimal hassle.

**Connect with Ukama**

They actively encourage community involvement and contributions, especially from those who share a love for open-source technologies. If this resonates with you, consider contributing to their Github or following them on Twitter. You can get in touch through their email at hello@ukama.com or explore their website for more information: [Ukama Official Site](http://www.ukama.com).

In a world where less than 20% of the population in places like the Democratic Republic of Congo has internet access, Ukama represents a beacon of hope for enhanced connectivity. With their innovative approach, they're not just building networks; they're building the future of connectivity—node by node. 

So, if you're looking for ways to contribute to a more connected world, Ukama is the place to join the movement!
